intro: Suaeda triandra, commonly known as sea sparrowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Middle East, where it thrives in saline and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dune habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Suaeda triandra plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
